title: Having problem cloning repro in Visual Studio 2015 Update 2
body:
I'm getting this message when trying to clone the repro:
    "The repository was cloned, but an error was encountered while recursively cloning submodules.     Error message: The top level repository was cloned, but there was an error cloning its submodules."

I don't have issues with other repros and github.

Thanks!

comments.author: migueldeicaza
comments.body: Not a bug in SkiaSharp, we will keep an eye though.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: I think this was maybe a error in the git clone? Delete the folder and try again or just delete the externals directory and revert and re update...

comments.author: emanolio
comments.body: This is also happening to me. I have Visual Studio 2015 Update 3. I deleted the clone multiple times and I still get this error. I installed Git for Windows and was able to clone the repository just fine. I'd rather use Visual Studio.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
I haven't tested VS2015 yet, but VS2017 works fine for me. Maybe you had a connection hiccup.
Also, I just want to mention that the new master no longer supports VS2015 - we are working on VS2017.

comments.author: redwhat
comments.body: @mattleibow What do you mean by "the new master no longer supports VS2015"?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: Just that I haven't done any testing in VS2015 - we are moving on to VS2017 and not looking back! The chances are that things will still work, just that I am no longer doing any testing there and I may/may not fix any issues with VS2015. If you really need things to work in VS2015, you probably will have to send in a PR that fixes it yourself.
